qas.question: How long did it take von Neumann to figure a response to theory of incompleteness?
What was the consequence of the theory of incompleteness?

answers.text: usual axiomatic systems are unable to demonstrate their own consistency

qas.question: Upon revising the theory of incompleteness, what was the name of the new Godel theory?

context: But von Neumann, who had participated at the Congress, confirmed his fame as an instantaneous thinker, and in <a0_0>less than a month<a0_0/> was able to communicate to Gödel himself an interesting consequence of his theorem: namely that the <a1_0>usual axiomatic systems are unable to demonstrate their own consistency<a1_0/>. However, Gödel had already discovered this consequence, now known as his <a2_0>second incompleteness theorem<a2_0/> and sent von Neumann a preprint of his article containing both incompleteness theorems. Von Neumann acknowledged Gödel's priority in his next letter. He never thought much of "the American system of claiming personal priority for everything."
